intro: Calonemorchis pallida, commonly known as the pale calonemorchis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale green to white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
